summary: This is an email from an Associate Warden at MCC New York seeking clarification for a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death. It contains specific questions and answers about the circumstances of his death, notification of next of kin, life-saving measures, transport to hospital, time of death, FBI notification, his arrival date at MCC, and the charges against him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the correspondence. The email seeks information for a press release about his death at MCC New York.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, working with IPPA to finalize a press release about Epstein's death and requesting specific factual answers.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Epstein Death Press Release
events.description: An Associate Warden at MCC New York sends an email seeking answers to specific questions to finalize a press release about Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Staff found Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:30 am. Staff initiated life-saving measures.

events.title: Epstein Pronounced Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was pronounced dead at a local hospital at approximately 7:36 am.

events.title: Epstein Arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein first arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York at approximately 6:30 am on August 10, 2019, and staff initiated life-saving measures.
Epstein was transported to a local hospital by BOP staff and EMS, where he was pronounced dead at approximately 7:36 am.
Epstein's next of kin had not been notified at the time of this correspondence.
The FBI was notified of Epstein's death and it was being investigated.
Epstein was indicted for Sex Trafficking Conspiracy and Sex Trafficking of Minors, and first arrived at MCC New York on July 6, 2019.
